Act.definition: something done by a person in accordance with his or her free will [a tortious ] see also actus reus b

1 a.definition: something done by a person in accordance with his or her free will [a tortious ] see also

sub_terms.b: the failure to do something that one has a legal duty to do called also

2 a.definition: the formal product of a legislative bodythe formally declared will of a legislature the final requirement of which is usually the signature of the proper executive officer[an of Congress]

sub_terms.b: a decision or determination of a sovereign, a legislative council, or a court of justice compare

3.definition: to give a decision or award (as by vote of a deliberative body or by judicial decree) often used with[adjourned with several important matters still noton]
3.on: [adjourned with several important matters still not

1.definition: to carry into effect a determination of the willtake action

2.definition: to discharge the duties of a specified office or postperform a specified function used with a prepositional phrase [declaring what officer shall then as President "art. II"]
